result.execSummary:
The defendant Will M. Fields was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possession of Cocaine/Coca, an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(c).
  • Possess Drug Paraphernalia, an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 961.573(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
Defendant to report to Probation today October 22, 2014 by 11:30 a.m.

  
In the event that the defendant is revoked or discharged from either probation or extended supervision with outstanding financial obligations, the supervising agent shall notify the court 10 days prior to the revocation or discharge.  A civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victim(s) and/or governmental entities for any balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect all debt.

miscConds.notes:
$243.00 to be collected by DOC as a condition of probation in Count 1 Case #14CF160.
$200.00 DNA surcharge to be collected by DOC as a condition of probation in Count 1 Case #14CF160.

-Cooperate with any correctional program or assessment as directed by Agent.
-Absolute sobriety:  Zero alcohol, zero controlled substances, zero prescribed medications (except as taken and prescribed for you by a physician) in your system, on your person, or in your possession at all times. This prohibition includes drug paraphernalia. 
-Not to enter any business or establishment where the primary purpose is sale of alcohol.
-Not to operate a motor vehicle without a valid license.
-Random UA's and PBT's.
-Follow all rules and regulations of Agent.
-Pay Supervision fees.
AODA within 30 days and follow recommended treatment.

CO: Vlack, DAR: Frank, Clerk: Minot, ADA:  Amber L Hahn   DF ATTY:  Joseph R. Caton   DF:  Will M. Fields appeared. Case called at 10:52 am. There is an agreement. Count 1 is amended to a Misdemeanor Violation. Count 2 stays the same. 
Court reviews constitutional rights with Def. Court finds def freely, voluntarily and knowingly waives rights. Court reads charge and possible penalties for amended count one  and count 2, def pleads guilty. Court uses complaints and reports as factual basis, accepts plea and adjudicates Def Guilty of amended Count 1 and count 2. Atty Caton makes statement. ADA Hahn makes recommendations. Atty Caton responds. Court orders,
2 years Probation W/H - 
Count 1,
- Court Costs
- DNA Surcharge
- 60 Days Jail STAYED
- AODA
- Psychological/Psychiatric Evaluation if requested
- Cooperate with any correction program or Assessment as directed
- Absolute sobriety:  Zero alcohol, zero controlled substances, zero prescribed medications (except as taken and prescribed for you by a physician) in your system, on your person, or in your possession at all times. This prohibition includes drug paraphernalia.
- Not to enter any business or establishment where the primary purpose is sale of alcohol, other than empplyment
- Not to operate a motor vehicle w/o a valid license
- Random UA's and PBT's
- Follow all rules and regulations of agent
- Pay supervision fees
 
Count 2,
Court Costs
DNA Surcharge
